text:
Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In general, people are more empathetic towards the suffering of animals, because they view animals as innocent and helpless. For most instances, animals cannot do something to prevent or even ease the issues that causes them to suffer. For that I believe many are more empathetic towards animals, than they would be for a person that is suffering as well.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In general, people are more empathetic towards the suffering of animals, because they view animals as innocent and helpless. For most instances, animals cannot do something to prevent or even ease the issues that causes them to suffer. For that I believe many are more empathetic towards animals, than they would be for a person that is suffering as well. Say for instance, poverty and sickness, many would make the assumption that people that suffer from either could do something about their situation, such as getting medical help or acquiring a job/financial assistance. Therefore, it is not unusual that many who be more quick to aid an animal over a person, as they ultimately view people as much more capable of handling their own problems.

However, I do not believe that it is wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In general, people are more empathetic towards the suffering of animals, because they view animals as innocent and helpless. For most instances, animals cannot do something to prevent or even ease the issues that causes them to suffer. For that I believe many are more empathetic towards animals, than they would be for a person that is suffering as well. Say for instance, poverty and sickness, many would make the assumption that people that suffer from either could do something about their situation, such as getting medical help or acquiring a job/financial assistance. Therefore, it is not unusual that many who be more quick to aid an animal over a person, as they ultimately view people as much more capable of handling their own problems.

However, I do not believe that it is wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering. I believe that it is important to help both humans and animals, as they are both living creatures that feel pain and have conscious thoughts. Although animals may not be able to vocalize or ask for help, they nevertheless have the desire to live free from harm and the threats of death, just like people do. In any case, a person that focuses on one cause over the other is not necessarily uncaring towards the other cause.

In general, people are more empathetic towards the suffering of animals, because they view animals as innocent and helpless. For most instances, animals cannot do something to prevent or even ease the issues that causes them to suffer. For that I believe many are more empathetic towards animals, than they would be for a person that is suffering as well. Say for instance, poverty and sickness, many would make the assumption that people that suffer from either could do something about their situation, such as getting medical help or acquiring a job/financial assistance. Therefore, it is not unusual that many who be more quick to aid an animal over a person, as they ultimately view people as much more capable of handling their own problems.

However, I do not believe that it is wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering. I believe that it is important to help both humans and animals, as they are both living creatures that feel pain and have conscious thoughts. Although animals may not be able to vocalize or ask for help, they nevertheless have the desire to live free from harm and the threats of death, just like people do. In any case, a person that focuses on one cause over the other is not necessarily uncaring towards the other cause. It is just that they have chosen to focus on one cause over the other.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In general, people are more empathetic towards the suffering of animals, because they view animals as innocent and helpless. For most instances, animals cannot do something to prevent or even ease the issues that causes them to suffer. For that I believe many are more empathetic towards animals, than they would be for a person that is suffering as well. Say for instance, poverty and sickness, many would make the assumption that people that suffer from either could do something about their situation, such as getting medical help or acquiring a job/financial assistance. Therefore, it is not unusual that many who be more quick to aid an animal over a person, as they ultimately view people as much more capable of handling their own problems.

However, I do not believe that it is wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering. I believe that it is important to help both humans and animals, as they are both living creatures that feel pain and have conscious thoughts. Although animals may not be able to vocalize or ask for help, they nevertheless have the desire to live free from harm and the threats of death, just like people do. In any case, a person that focuses on one cause over the other is not necessarily uncaring towards the other cause. It is can very much be that they have chosen to focus on one cause over the other at a given point in their life, and they may help more humanitarian or animal welfare causes in the future. It can be daunting for many to volunteer their time and donate money and resources for a variety of causes.

Is It Wrong to Focus on Animal Welfare When Humans Are Suffering?

Would you be surprised to hear that a study found that research subjects were more upset by stories of a dog beaten by a baseball bat than of an adult similarly beaten? Or that other researchers found that if forced to choose, 40 percent of people would save their pet dog over a foreign tourist.

Why do you think many people are more empathetic toward the suffering of animals than that of people? In your opinion, is it wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering? Why do you think so?

---

In general, people are more empathetic towards the suffering of animals, because they view animals as innocent and helpless. For most instances, animals cannot do something to prevent or even ease the issues that causes them to suffer. For that I believe many are more empathetic towards animals, than they would be for a person that is suffering as well. Say for instance, poverty and sickness, many would make the assumption that people that suffer from either could do something about their situation, such as getting medical help or acquiring a job/financial assistance. Therefore, it is not unusual that many who be more quick to aid an animal over a person, as they ultimately view people as much more capable of handling their own problems.

However, I do not believe that it is wrong to focus on animal welfare when humans are suffering. I believe that it is important to help both humans and animals, as they are both living creatures that feel pain and have conscious thoughts. Although animals may not be able to vocalize or ask for help, they nevertheless have the desire to live free from harm and the threats of death, just like people do. In any case, a person that focuses on one cause over the other is not necessarily uncaring towards the other cause. It is can very much be that they have chosen to focus on one cause over the other at a given point in their life, and they may help more humanitarian or animal welfare causes in the future. 

It can be daunting for many to volunteer their time and donate money and resources for a variety of causes. Some may feel that their money might be wasted, or the particular charity they donated would be inefficient in utilizing their donations. For that reason, I think many chose to focus on one cause, such as animal welfare to reduce the time and effort on their behalf on researching whether their time and efforts are being adequately utilized to further the cause. In those instances, they are likely to make a greater impact on the cause they chose to focus on, than if they were to spread out their focus on several causes at once. As long as they take the time to better the welfare of either animals or humans, I think that is more impactful than if they were to not take the time to help at all. For many will invest their time, money, and resources towards the betterment of animals and humans. For that, I don't consider them unethical for focusing on one over the other, as they still are trying to resolve issues that affects many in the world, that requires immediate attention from those that can help.
